Description: Fifteen fragments of undyed cotton cord and brown human hair string used as binding. Four cotton cords, eight dark brown human hair strings and three fragments with both cotton cords and human hair string knotted together. The hair consists of 3 's'-spun then 'z'-plied elements. The cotton string cord consists of 2 ‘s’-spun then ‘z’-plied elements, with three of these elements ‘s’-plied. The fragments are knotted in several places and the human hair string is tied to the cotton cord.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 62)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.25E (excavation object cat. no.)
